questionText: __________ converts the programs written in assembly language into machine instructions.
The instructions like MOV or ADD are called as ______
The alternate way of writing the instruction, ADD #5,R1 is ______
Instructions which wonâ€™t appear in the object program are called as _____
The assembler directive EQU, when used in the instruction: Sum EQU 200 does ________
choiceA: Finds the first occurrence of Sum and assigns value 200 to it
choiceB: Replaces every occurrence of Sum with 200
choiceC: Re-assigns the address of Sum by adding 200 to its original address
choiceD: Assigns 200 bytes of memory starting the location of Sum

questionText: The purpose of the ORIGIN directive is __________
choiceA: To indicate the starting position in memory, where the program block is to be stored
choiceB: To indicate the starting of the computation code
choiceC: To indicate the purpose of the code
choiceD: To list the locations of all the registers used

questionText: The directive used to perform initialization before the execution of the code is ______
_____ directive is used to specify and assign the memory required for the block of code.
_____ directive specifies the end of execution of a program.
The last statement of the source program should be _______
When dealing with the branching code the assembler ___________
choiceA: Replaces the target with its address
choiceB: Does not replace until the test condition is satisfied
choiceC: Finds the Branch offset and replaces the Branch target with it
choiceD: Replaces the target with the value specified by the DATAWORD directive

questionText: The assembler stores all the names and their corresponding values in ______
The assembler stores the object code in ______
